# Project Code of Conduct: Wikisox

## Our Commitment

We, the contributors and project maintainers, pledge to create an open and welcoming environment for everyone. We respect diversity of opinions and experiences, and we encourage participation from all individuals.

## Our Standards

Here are some examples of behavior that contributes to creating a positive environment:

- Respecting others' opinions and experiences
- Being courteous and professional in discussions
- Accepting constructive criticism
- Focusing on what is best for the community

Here are examples of unacceptable behavior:

- Harassment, insults, or personal attacks
- Offensive comments related to gender, sexual orientation, race, religion, etc.
- Trolling, spam, or any other disruptive behavior

## Our Responsibilities

Project maintainers are responsible for clarifying the standards of acceptable behavior and are expected to take appropriate corrective action in response to any instances of unacceptable behavior. They have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject comments, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions that do not align with this Code of Conduct, or to temporarily or permanently ban any contributor for behaviors that are deemed inappropriate.

## Scope

This code of conduct applies to all spaces of the project, including the GitHub repository, discussions, issues, wiki, etc. It also applies to interactions with project maintainers and other contributors.

## Enforcement

If you encounter unacceptable behavior, please report the incident to contact@theomeunier.fr . All complaints will be reviewed and investigated, and appropriate action will be taken. Project maintainers are obligated to maintain confidentiality regarding the reporter of an incident.

## Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant, version 1.4. For more information, please visit the [Contributor Covenant website](https://www.contributor-covenant.org/).

Remember to replace Wikisox and contact@theomeunier.fr with the specific information for your project. We hope this helps establish a positive and inclusive environment for your community! ðŸ˜Š
